Job Description  Requisition Number: 5631       Required Travel: 0 - 10%     Employment Type: Full Time/Hourly/Non-Exempt     Hours Per Week: 40     Security Clearance: Secret     Level of Experience: Entry     Employee Referral Bonus Amount: ERP Amount: $1,000         Summary     Mission Technologies, as division of Huntington Ingalls Industries is are seeking a Specification Writer too develop procedures used for the operation of equipment and systems aboard modern nuclear submarines, and other manuals used for training of personnel and maintenance of these systems.     As new or modernized equipment is installed aboard submarines, the Specification Writer examines the technical documentation (drawings, specification sheets, etc.) and procedures (technical manuals, component procedures and descriptions, etc.) supplied by vendors and system/equipment design engineers and agencies to develop standardized procedures and manuals to be used by sailors aboard the submarine and maintenance personnel who will be maintaining and testing these systems.     The Specification Writer works with other writers, engineers, supply vendors, and the Navy to ensure the best and complete information is made available to the submarine fleet. #LI-CJ1 *EP *MV          What You Will Do          Prepares specifications from engineering change notices, customer specifications, and/or published data sheets.      Maintains customer specifications files; reviews customer drawings and data; translates customer language into standard procedures and product flow.              What You Must Have          High School Diploma or equivalent and 6 years additional education and/or related experience.      Have background experience in shipboard electrical distribution systems, mechanical and auxiliary systems, or Naval Nuclear Power operational experience.      Must be able to obtain and maintain a secret security clearance.      Knowledgeable and experience in using Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, and Adobe.              Bonus Points For          Possess operational and maintenance experience on submarine electrical distribution system or mechanical and auxiliary systems.              Physical Requirements    Most work is performed in an office environment with the possibility of some time spent aboard ships or in industrial conditions. Able to work on and climb ladders. Able to work in extreme temperature environments, aboard ships, in shipyards, under industrial conditions and in confined spaces. Environment may involve high heat, humidity, noise, and dirty conditions. Travel may be required within and outside of the continental United States.        HII’s Mission Technologies division develops integrated solutions that enable today’s connected, all-domain force. Capabilities include C5ISR systems and operations; the application of AI and machine learning to battlefield decisions; defensive and offensive cyberspace strategies and EW; unmanned, autonomous systems; LVC solutions; platform modernization; and critical nuclear operations. Together, HII's domain expertise and advanced technologies support mission partners anywhere around the globe. For more information, visit tsd.huntingtoningalls.com.     HII is a global engineering and defense technologies provider. With a 135-year history of trusted partnerships in advancing U.S. national security, HII delivers critical capabilities ranging from the most powerful and survivable naval ships ever built, to unmanned systems, ISR and AI/ML analytics. HII leads the industry in mission-driven solutions that support and enable a networked, all-domain force. Headquartered in Virginia, HII’s skilled workforce is 44,000 strong.     Huntington Ingalls Industries is an Equal Opportunity/Vets and Disabled Employer. U.S. Citizenship may be required for certain positions. QinetiQ is seeking an experienced Human Resources Manager to support QinetiQ’s people strategy, along with the associated processes and tools. This will allow our leaders to an Identify, Manage and Develop their people. The HR Manager is responsible for supporting the configuration, maintenance, operation, and ongoing administration of the SuccessFactors system across the QinetiQ US. Your Contribution to the Mission Ensure a fair and consistent interpretation and application of Company policies, practices and procedures that create and maintain a people first culture. Provide support across the global SAP SuccessFactors system, incorporating Employee Central, Recruitment Management, Recruitment Marketing, Onboarding, Learning Management, Performance & Goal Management, Compensation Management, Succession and Development. Partner with key business stakeholders and Centre of Excellence SAP system administrators to configure, maintain, and operate the SuccessFactors environment to support business processes, in line with QinetiQ change control processes. Troubleshoot issues/incidents related to data issues, upgrades, releases, fixes and enhancements, working closely with internal Centre of Excellence teams and 3rd party support partners to ensure successful resolution to agreed SLA’s. Monitor SAP SuccessFactors integration(s) and any integrations to 3rd party vendor solutions working closely with internal Centre of Excellence teams and global 3rd party support partners to resolve any issues to successful resolution. Gather business change requirements, raise configuration change requests and support the management of changes through the change control processes maintaining change management tools and documentation. Perform configuration changes across the SuccessFactors module suite based on the QinetiQ SuccessFactors support model, (e.g., Foundation Objects, notifications, workflows, alerts, picklists, business rules, Home Page Themes/Tiles etc.) coordinating all testing activities (Unit and UAT) and managing through the change control process. Assign and maintain role-based permissions along with supporting audit compliance activities. Perform regular system monitoring, verifying the integrity and availability the system, including workflow management. Perform data imports as and when required in support of incident resolution and change management activities. Provide end user support and coaching to ensure adoption and ease of use along with training and support to key stakeholders to ensure alignment and knowledge transfer. Participate in half-yearly SuccessFactors release activities working along-side the 3rd party support partner to review and assess impact on existing functionality and identify potential enhancements. Develop, maintain, and support a variety of reports utilizing appropriate reporting tools including Advanced Reporting. Provide analysis where appropriate. Foster change leadership, act as an HR brand ambassador, and drive culture by caring for our team members, our vendors and our customers. Help manage company organizational structure, roles, responsibilities, and staffing levels. To Land This Job, You Need Bachelor’s degree 5+ years HR Generalist experience with a government contractor Experience of SAP SuccessFactors is essential with a minimum of 2 years support experience within a global corporate environment. Deep and broad understanding of end-to-end HR processes and the corporate systems used to support them. (i.e., Benefits, Payroll, recruitment) Advanced administrator skills in Employee Central with experience in making configuration changes and handling data imports. Strong background in supporting HRIS solutions and resolving integration issues (i.e., Payroll and Benefits) Strong knowledge of SuccessFactors and the wider SAP product and systems landscape Knowledge and experience with all federal and state regulations, filing, and compliance requirements, including COBRA, FMLA, DOL/FLSA, FMLA, and state leave laws. Exceptional problem-solving skills and the ability to see the wider picture to identify the root causes and recommend corrective and preventative actions. Quality-oriented with a keen eye towards attention to detail. Highly organized, able to multi-task and meet deadlines. Ability to work efficiently and effectively both independently and in a team environment. Excellent customer service, interpersonal and communication skills. Who Are We? We are a world-class team of professionals who deliver next generation technology and products in robotic and autonomous platforms, ground, soldier, and maritime systems in 50+ locations world-wide. Much of our work contributes to innovative research in the fields of sensor science, signal processing, data fusion, artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and augmented reality (AR). QinetiQ Inc.’s dedicated experts in defense, aerospace, security, and related fields all work together to explore new ways of protecting the American Warfighter, Security Forces, and Allies. Being a part of QinetiQ Inc. means being central to the safety and security of the world around us. Partnering with our customers, we help save lives; reduce risks to society; and maintain the global infrastructure on which we all depend. Why Join QinetiQ Inc.? If you have the courage to take on a wide variety of complex challenges, then you will experience a unique working environment where innovative teams blend different perspectives, disciplines, and technologies to discover new ways of solving complex problems. In our diverse and inclusive environment, you can be authentic, feel valued, be respected, and realize your full potential. QinetiQ Inc. will support you with workplace flexibility, a commitment to the health and well-being of you and your family and provide opportunities to work with a purpose. We are committed to supporting your success in both your professional and personal lives. QinetiQ is seeking a Proposal Manage r with extensive knowledge and strong communication skills to join our team of well qualified, diverse individuals . The Proposal Manager is responsible for resources, planning, scheduling, development, and production of federal proposals. coordinating submissions and collections Meeting proposal deadlines by establishing priorities and target dates for information gathering, writing review, and approval; entering and monitoring tracking data; coordinating requirements with contributors Clearly conveying win themes, value propositions, and differentiators in both written and verbal form Facilitating proposal strategy sessions Performing market, client, and competitive research related to proposal efforts Managing and updating pipeline database Leading proposal teams from Go/No-Go decisions through the entire capture process Identifying and collaborate with teaming partners  To Land This Job You'll Need: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Business or a related field; IT or Engineering field desirable Three to seven years of related (proposal preparation in a government contracting) experience with a proven track record of winning proposal efforts valued at $40M or more•Knowledge of federal procurement regulations (FAR/DFAR) Experience with MS Office Suite Experience with Adobe Photoshop and illustrator Experience with Desktop Publishing software Strong analytical and problem solving skills Strong Proposal Leadership skills, with the ability to build a strong team, effectively resolve conflict, and vector appropriate resources to maximize proposal development Excellent organizational skills Ability to work independently and with minimum supervision under a system of discipline, deadlines and accountability Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations Ability to work a flexible schedule which may include evenings and weekends Fluent in speaking, reading, and writing the English language  COVID-19 Vaccination Policy: In accordance with the Executive Order on Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors, all QinetiQ Inc. employees, including employees working from home/remotely, are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless an exemption is approved by QinetiQ Inc. Job Category  Customer Success Group       Job Details     We are hiring for experienced  Business Analytics & Data Science Consultants  across our various US-based office locations. The team works directly with customers to provide Data Visualization, Data Science and Business Analytics solutions and consulting services.        Team members play a key role in helping businesses to identify descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive insights that drive operational improvements across multiple industries.        We are looking for strategic, analytical thinkers with business skills to join one of the fastest growing areas of our business. You must have the ability to apply analytics and advanced analytics techniques on varied data, while understanding business objectives, managing client expectations, communicating effectively, and delivering results to the client.        Responsibilities:         Participate in discussions with clients to address and answer specific business questions, capture requirements and provide consultative guidance on solution/delivery options      Partner with internal and client teams to develop innovative analytics solutions that solve business challenges and align to industry best practices      Proactively analyze large and complex customer data sets to provide valuable insights and findings that may not currently be known or evident to clients within various industries      Perform analytic software configuration and coding      Incorporate analytics and findings into compelling stories for customer consumption      Clearly and succinctly communicate findings and insights to customers with proper verification and validation techniques      Create functional and technical documentation      Continuously develop technical and consulting skills           Requirements:         Bachelors Degree or higher, preferably in a technical field      4+ years experience in the following:      Working in an analytical field      Working with Business Analytics and data visualization tools to perform insights analysis on varied data (E.g. Join our team and begin tackling critical issues at all levels of government in a team-focused environment with an emphasis on personal and professional growth. Now more than ever, organizations need support to address pressing needs in accounting, budgeting/forecasting, financial reporting, assurance, and internal controls. Accounting & Internal Controls (A&IC) is well-positioned to help our clients address their most urgent finance transformation needs. If you are interested in helping organizations effectively managefinancial risks, then our team would be a great fit for you!            Work you'll do             Perform audit readiness including FISCAM, NIST 800-53      Perform audit readiness supporting remediation of client's audit material weaknesses      Access controls and internal controls      Assist with accounting and financial reporting            T    he team          Deloitte's Government and Public Services (GPS) practice - our people, ideas, technology and outcomes-is designed for impact. Serving federal, state, & local government clients as well as public higher education institutions, our team of over 15,000+ professionals brings fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill their mission promise.         Our team of data analysts and data scientists help transform the controllership and treasury organization by leveraging technologies such as artificial intelligence and machine learning to build capabilities that lead to increased efficiency and impact decision making. Our services include diagnosis analytics, process automation, analytics insight, data visualization, and financial modeling to help implement new or improved strategies in the operating model.            Qualifications          Required:            Bachelor's degree in Accounting required      Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future      Active TS/SCI with Polygraph security clearance required      Travel up to 25%         Preferred:            Federal consulting experience      Governmental accounting experience      Demonstrated experience with Momentum software      CPA, CISA, CDFM, CGFM, CFE            How you'll grow         At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there's always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

7+ years of experience in the design and implementation of complex IT systems     Implementation and architecture experience in big data, data warehousing, data lake, operational analytics, data migration, and/or integration scenarios. (Amazon EMR, Hadoop, Spark, R, Presto, Hive, Amazon Redshift, Teradata, Vertica, Glue, Data Migration Services)     Job summary   Do you like to solve the most complex and large-scale data challenges in the world today? Do you want to have an impact in the development and use of new ways to explore data? Come join us.      Amazon Web Services (AWS) offers a comprehensive set of services to handle every step of the analytics process chain including data warehousing, business intelligence, batch processing, stream processing, log analytics, and data workflow orchestration.      We are looking for an Analytics Specialized Solutions Architect, who will be the Subject Matter Expert (SME) for helping customers solve data challenges and create new solutions/capabilities for their customers. You will partner with Sales Account Managers, Business Development Representatives and the AWS Service teams to enable customer adoption and revenue attainment.      You will develop white papers, blogs, sample dashboards, labs, and presentations to evangelize BI design patterns and best practices. You will also mentor and train the broader SA population within AWS, teaching them how to integrate Amazon Analytic Solutions appropriately into customer architectures.      The ideal candidate will …   Be great fun to work with. Our company credo is “Work hard. Have fun. Make history”. As the right candidate, you will love what you do, and instinctively know how to make work fun. You will be dynamic and creative, and willing to take on any challenge.      Enjoy working with customers. You have a passion for educating, training, designing, and building cloud computing systems for some of the world’s fastest growing.      Be Customer Obsessed. At AWS, customer obsession is in our DNA. You will represent the voice of the customer in field engagements with AWS specialist sales, business development, and service teams.      Be an Architect. As part of a Solutions Architecture team, you produce and validate reference architectures and customer adoption for AWS Analytics services including, Amazon Redshift, Amazon EMR, Amazon Data Lakes and Amazon QuickSight.        Specific responsibilities include:          Designing Data and Analytics solutions.  Work with teams at existing and potential customers to deeply understand their business and technical needs. Develop solutions that make the best use of the AWS Cloud platform and Analytics Services. Collaborate with AWS field sales, training, and support teams to ensure customer success.     Partnering with account teams, Business Development Managers and Analytics Service teams to accelerate customer adoption and revenue attainment.     Be the voice of the customer to service engineering teams, providing product improvement feedback to AWS developers and accelerating the adoption of new features in customer deployments.     Sharing what you know by capturing best-practice knowledge from engineering and field teams, including reference architectures and patterns, with the worldwide AWS solution architect community in order to build a strong worldwide database and analytics community     Exhibiting thought leadership. Evangelize AWS Services and Analytics Solutions in the Data and Analytics domain. Share best practices through forums such as AWS blogs, whitepapers, reference architectures and public speaking events such as AWS Summit and AWS re: Invent.     About the team   Inclusive Team Culture      Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.      Work/Life Balance   Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.      Mentorship & Career Growth      Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.            Experience working with customers and stakeholders and driving outcomes in a pre-sales capacity     Working knowledge of modern software development practices and technologies     Available for travel up to 25%     An advanced degree in computer science, MIS, engineering or related discipline     Hands-on experience with Amazon Web Services     Demonstrated industry leadership in the fields of Big Data processing, Database, Data Warehousing and Data Sciences     Deep understanding of data, application, server, and network security     Experience with Statistics, Machine Learning and Predictive Modelling     Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. About GridPoint:     GridPoint is a smart building technology leader with a mission focused on enabling the world’s transition to an efficient and sustainable future through smart, grid-connected buildings. Our hardware-enabled subscription offerings bridge the gap between commercial businesses, utilities, and technology partners to support grid modernization and bring outdated energy infrastructure to the 21st century. Powered by the best data, our platform is designed to identify best-fit energy strategies, reduce waste, and make buildings smarter through controls, automation, and machine learning.        Job Summary:     GridPoint will double the number of sites we manage by the end of 2022. Because our product is delivered as an equipment-enabled Energy Management Subscription Service, we rely on a delivery process that is seamless for our customers.         Commissioning Approval is a Quality Assurance group who works closely with the Commissioning team. By utilizing internal installation and GridPoint contractors, the Commissioning team ensures the live connection of an installed EMS system by diagnosing, troubleshooting, and running reports to ensure proper EMS functionality. In the role of Commission Approver, your task would be to review the commissioning documentation, configurations and testing results for accuracy based on specific metrics, customer requirements, and scope of work. job_title: Product Owner - Strategy & Analytics, Deloitte Consulting, LLP
job_Description: Work You'll Do:         This role will be aligned to the product management team of Deloitte's Strategy & Analytics Hybrid Solutions & Incubation (HS&I) practice, focused on the life sciences industry.        As a product owner working in this practice, you will play a critical role in designing, building, supporting and delivering an innovative technology solution that leverages analytics and artificial intelligence to reimagine the manufacturing function for life science organizations. This product suite is providing novel capabilities that enable life science companies to improve the speed, accuracy, and efficiency of their manufacturing decision-making while reducing operational costs.        The right candidate will utilize their extensive experience from the life sciences manufacturing industry in order to help define the product's roadmap and work closely with engineering teams on detailed specifications, including analytical models, user interface, architecture, and integration with other products and data sources. As well as work with product marketing, sales, and consulting teams to drive sales and customer adoption.        You should have the ability to collaborate and align with technical and non-technical stakeholders, experience translating customer needs into technical product requirements, and working with engineering to build and deliver world-class products.           Key Responsibilities:             Analyze and report on the key data, analytical, and technological capabilities that are needed in order to address systemic manufacturing issues for life sciences organizations      Analyze and report on competitor products in the marketplace in order to diagnose capability gaps or differentiators of the Deloitte product, and articulate strategic steps necessarily in order to maintain a competitive position      Lead a multi-functional and mutli-geographical team across the product lifecycle from requirement identification through execution      Work with internal engineering team/product development on product build lifecycles, assist in tasks necessary to make a developed product market ready      Take a high-level idea or requirement, and engage with various stakeholders to scope out the idea (including detailed requirements, mockups, prototypes, etc.) to a level of detail needed for engineering teams to go through development      Play a hands on role in in the agile software development lifecycle by reviewing user stories, grooming backlogs, running sprint review/sprint showcases and other similar activities      Lead the development of marketing collateral such as presentations, sales tools, marketing collateral, and product demonstrations      Monitor, analyze and report on customer/decision-maker/end-user feedback and manage evolution of the product in the marketplace      Provide timely reporting of alpha/beta programs, product launches/extensions, and ongoing sales, revenue and profitability performance against defined business targets            Qualifications            Required:             Bachelor's Degree in a relevant field from a top-tier university; Advanced Degree is a plus - equivalent work experience may act as a substitute to degree requirements      8+ years of proven success in a fast-paced product management or management consulting role in the manufacturing space      Extensive experience in the biopharma manufacturing industry      Excellent verbal and written communication skills      Highly self-motivated, energetic, passionate team-oriented personality and working style      Proven ability to successfully partner with internal stakeholders from various parts of the organization and drive successful outcomes cross-functionally;      Experience working closely with engineering organization to define applications and tools and manage them through the entire product life cycle      Strong analytical background combined with solid business experience      Willingness to travel (25%) periodically - as future will allow given current COVID19 restrictions      Limited immigration sponsorship may be available.            Preferred:             Experience in new product development from ideation specification      Experience working with advanced analytical models, including machine learning / AI      Experience crafting impactful PowerPoint presentations      Experience working across brand, sales, and marketing agencies      Experience in agile software development methodology, and use of agile software development productivity tools (i.e. JIRA, Confluence)      Ability to juggle many competing priorities/deadlines

job_title: Systems Engineer - Guidance, Navigation, Control and Perception
job_Description: Do you want to be a part of something bigger? A team whose impact stretches across the world, and even beyond? At Collins Aerospace, our Mission Systems team helps civilian, military and government customers complete their most complex missions — whatever and wherever they may be. Our customers depend on us for intelligent and secure communications, missionized systems for specialized aircraft and spacecraft and collaborative space solutions. By joining our team, you’ll have your own critical part to play in ensuring our customer succeeds today while anticipating their needs for tomorrow. Are you up for the challenge? Join our mission today.        Systems Engineer  - Mission Systems        Our Mission Systems Flight Control and Navigation group, located in Sterling Virginia, advances embedded Guidance Navigation, Control and Perception systems for a wide variety of military and commercial customers across the world. This means we are responsible for primary guidance, flight control and navigation on a variety of UAS platforms. It also means you get to bring estimation and control expertise to a variety of products/applications across Collins aerospace (Navigation for Ground/Air/Sea, Certified Avionics Systems, Inertial Navigation Systems). Are you ready to learn from the most knowledgeable experts in the industry, develop the technologies of tomorrow and reach new heights in your career? Join our Flight Control and Navigation team today.        Role Overview:        As part of a highly dynamic team of engineers, you will be asked to apply your knowledge in the following areas to a variety of products/applications that are relevant to both military and commercial industries:         System dynamics and state estimation (linear/nonlinear, navigation/PNT, cooperative PNT, distributed PNT, inertial sensor modeling, oscillator modeling)      Guidance (path planning, cooperative teaming, swarm optimization, tactical maneuvering, dog-fighting)      Control (Fixed Wing, VTOL, HVTOL, Rotorcraft)      Perception (Classification, Identification, SLAM, Feature tracking, Automatic Target Recognition)           This role requires a focus on innovation & strong execution, as well as a deep theoretical understanding of estimation, control, guidance and perception theory. The ideal candidate will have an advanced degree in a relevant STEM field and enjoy collaborating with a highly dynamic team of their peers.        Primary Responsibilities:         Responsible for the development and prototyping of advanced algorithms that address current challenges faced in the areas of Guidance, Navigation and Control when operating in both uncontested and contested environments      Responsible for supporting integration, verification, validation, and flight readiness qualification of advanced algorithms into a variety of platforms (lab simulators/demonstrators, flight test platforms, fielded UAV/OPV platforms)      Support strategic Science and Technology (S&T) Program Pursuits.      Support development of Technical Roadmaps      Proficient in leading small teams of Engineers (Algorithm, Systems, Software, Hardware, Test) to quickly prove out advanced GNC concepts.      Comfortable working in an environment that encourages “first principles” solutions to complex and challenging physics problems.           Basic Qualifications:         Bachelor’s degree and 2 years of prior relevant experience OR  In absence of a degree, 6 years of relevant experience is required      Typically requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and a minimum of 2 years of prior relevant experience unless prohibited by local laws/regulations      Must be a U.S. Person/Permanent Resident “Green Card” holder           A strong theoretical background in one or more of the following areas is needed:         System dynamics modeling (Fixed Wing, VTOL, HVTOL, Rotorcraft)      State estimation (linear/nonlinear, navigation/PNT, cooperative PNT, distributed PNT, oscillator modeling)      Simultaneous Localization and Mapping or SLAM (lidar, radar, imu, etc)      Experience working with GPS in both ground and air applications.      Guidance (tactical maneuvering, relative maneuvering, multi-platform coordinated guidance)      Control (linear control, nonlinear control concepts, time-critical cooperative control)           Preferred Qualifications         Machine Learning and AI concepts as they relate to perception systems, path planning, and decision making is desired.      Empathy, curiosity, and desire to constantly improve, acquire new skills and drive for results.      Passion for technology, business, market trends and, most specifically, adding value to the industry.      Possesses strong strategic, critical, and problem-solving thinking      Strong interpersonal skills      Expertise in innovation & the ability to think strategically about how to advance business-led solutions      Experience in developing system level solutions that integrate multiple systems into a single offering is also desired.      More than 3 years of GNC experience (post degree)           Diversity drives innovation; inclusion drives success .   We believe a multitude of approaches and ideas enable us to deliver the best results for our workforce, workplace, and customers. We are committed to fostering a culture where all employees can share their passions and ideas so we can tackle the toughest challenges in our industry and pave new paths to limitless possibility.     Some of our competitive benefits package includes:         Medical, dental, and vision insurance      Three weeks of vacation for newly hired employees      Generous 401(k) plan that includes employer matching funds and separate employer retirement contribution, including a Lifetime Income Strategy option      Tuition reimbursement      Life insurance and disability coverage      Optional coverages you can buy: Pet Insurance, Home and Auto, additional life insurance, accident insurance, critical illness insurance, group legal      Ovia Health, fertility and family planning      Employee Assistance Plan, including up to 5 free counseling sessions      Redbrick - Incentives for a Healthy You      Autism Benefit      Doctor on Demand, virtual doctor visits      Adoption Assistance      Best Doctors, second opinion program      And more!           Nothing matters more to Collins Aerospace than our strong ethical and safety commitments. As such, all U.S. positions require a background check, which may include a drug screen.        At Collins, the paths we pave together lead to limitless possibility. And the bonds we form – with our customers and with each other - propel us all higher, again and again.        Apply now and be part of the team that’s redefining aerospace, every day.

Founded in 2005 by supply chain risk management expert Jennifer Bisceglie, we have grown into the largest and most influential player in the emerging operational resilience space. This past July we achieved $100 million dollars in Series C funding led by the investment firm Night Dragon, with additional participation from Series A and B investors Kleiner Perkins and Venrock. This latest round of funding brings Interos' valuation to $1billion, earning us unicorn status.  Based in Arlington, Va., Interos' breakthrough SaaS platform leverages artificial intelligence and machine learning to model the entire business ecosystems of companies into a living global map. Users can drill down to any single supplier, anywhere – helping businesses and government organizations reduce risk, avoid operational disruptions, and achieve dramatically superior resilience and performance. We have seen hypergrowth in the past 3 years and continue to expand our team across the US and several countries in Europe.  The Opportunity:   We are looking for a Federal Solutions Consultant who will own and drive the scoping and solution definition phase during the sales process with prospective clients. Our ideal candidate combines technical knowledge with strong communication skills. You will lead problem-solving sessions with customers and collaborate to map Interos' platform capabilities with customer's specific needs. You will work closely with our sales and product teams and constantly apply your problem-solving skills. You are interested in working with a dynamic, early-stage company and are excited to help shape our product.   Essential Functions/duties:  Responsible for becoming highly proficient on the Interos platform, Federal Civilian, Federal DOD/IC and/or A&D Supply Chain Use-Cases, value drivers and Federal Supply Chain policies.  Lead use case scoping sessions to understand customer challenges and connect the dots to our desired problem space and our platform capabilities.  Educate and engage with key business & technical stakeholders at customers to get buy-in and alignment on Interos' capabilities, machine learning models and data sources.  Use creativity and customer insight to build innovative POV's (proofs of value) that demonstrate the unique value proposition of our product to our customers.  Deliver impactful and contextual product demonstrations to current and potential clients that reflect current and future capabilities as part of the sales process.  Ability to do both technical deep-dives and lead data-science discussions is essential.  Partner closely with Product Management/Marketing and Engineering by participating in product planning and sharing feedback from the selling process.  Expand your knowledge on all things related to 3rd Party Risk Management, Supply Chain Risk Management, Supply Chain policies, AI/machine learning, and data science.  Design, develop, maintain, and present industry-based demo use-cases.  Mentorship of associate and entry-level team members.  Minimum Qualifications:  Bachelor's Degree with 5+ years of federal solutions consulting experience OR equivalent years of experience in a related fields within the federal and defense market.  Experience in successfully demonstrating and positioning complex, SaaS-based solutions to federal and defense customers.  Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.  Ability to conceptualize new solutions - be creative, not constrained by traditional methods/solutions.  Ability to work with individuals at varying levels of technical knowledge in a complex environment and resolve issues.  Ability to initiate and lead conversations with both internal and external teams.  Comfort in an environment that tests your adaptability and agility.  Ability to take ambiguous situations and apply a structured framework to get to a shared conclusion.  Must be a self-starter.  Active TS Security Clearance is a plus.  Preferred Qualifications:  Ability to independently identify, investigate and develop solutions to problems (business, operational and ideally technical).  Ability to manage multiple projects/initiatives to meet predetermined deadlines, setting direction for and ensuring the success of all prospect engagements.  Demonstrated proficiency in software productivity tools (CRM, word processing, spreadsheet, presentation, and database software) to meet goals of position.  Ability to function independently, with minimal supervision, setting direction communicating effectively with internal and client stakeholders, and enlisting help as needed.  Ability to establish friendly, professional, and cooperative relations with internal and external contacts.  Organizational Skills (strategic thinking, goal setting, business metrics driven, time management, etc.).   Vaccination Requirement:  Interos is required to comply with  Federal Executive Order 14042  mandating employees be vaccinated against COVID-19. All Interos employees must be fully vaccinated* against COVID-19, unless you have a legally valid medical or religious reason. Any requests for exemptions based on medical or sincerely held religious beliefs will be evaluated confidentially by our Chief People Officer after hiring.  Fully vaccinated means an individual must have received their second dose of the Moderna or Pfizer vaccine or the single dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine.  Benefits:   Comprehensive Health & Wellness package (Medical, Dental and Vision)  10 Paid Holiday Days Off  Flexible Paid Time Off (FTO)  Pet Insurance  401 (k) Employer Matching  Stock Options  Family Planning reimbursement  Legal Insurance  Identity Theft Protection  Child Tutoring Reimbursement  Career advancement opportunities  Casual Dress  On-site gym and dedicated Peloton room at headquarters  Company Events (Sports Games, Fitness Competitions, Birthday Celebrations, Contests, Happy Hours)  Annual company party  Employee Referral Program   Interos is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any other classification protected by law.  If you are a candidate in need of assistance or an accommodation in the application process, please contact HR@interos.ai

Description  Metric5 is currently seeking a Junior ETL Developer to work within a team providing Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence services to our government customer using Agile processes. You will work with our senior technical staff to help develop, deploy, and document data pipelines/ETL workflows, ingesting varying data sources with different schemas and data elements. You have a desire to support a multi-disciplinary team of analysts, data engineers, data scientists, developers, system engineers, and data consumers in a fast-paced environment. This is an excellent opportunity if you are interested in growing your analytical skills and learning how to execute ETL strategies using Informatica and other data ingestion tools and techniques to deliver Big Data solutions to meet mission critical reporting and data analytics needs.  Program Details  The program you will be supporting has a mission to provide development, security, and operations (DevSecOps) support to U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) with a focus on development, operations, and modernization of the Agency’s Enterprise Data Warehouse/Data Lake. The team utilizes open-source, AWS Cloud, and Big Data technologies, agile project management practices, and modern DevSecOps delivery to provide the business intelligence support systems to meet the reporting, data analytics, and machine learning/artificial intelligence needs critical to USCIS leadership, data/business analysts, data scientists, and other decision-makers.  Responsibilities:  Interact with product owners, system owners, and business owners of the source systems to understand transactional system data models and requirements  Implement ETL jobs by creating mappings, mapplets, sessions, and workflows, including data transformations, using informatica for multiple transactional systems to the target (including ODS, data marts, and data lake) according to documented logic and source-to-target mappings  Work with operations team to deploy and validate ETL jobs in integration, Staging and production environments  Interpret data models and other design documents  Create mapping documents  Participate in technical design reviews, code, and peer reviews  Monitor ETL/Informatica jobs in production environment  Debug and respond to dev-related help tickets  Help troubleshoot data discrepancy and missing data issues resulting from daily ETL loads  Create test documents and participate in unit, integration, and system testing  Re-develop legacy ETL code (i.e. PL/SQL, Materialized Views, Informatica PowerCenter) into modernized data pipelines  Learn new technologies, (i.e. AWS Data Migration Service, Databricks Scala, Kafka, Restful APIs) as needed to be able to deliver data ingestion solutions  Actively participate in Agile release and sprint planning, sprint grooming, artifact creation, sprint testing, demonstrations and retrospectives and solution releases.   Desired Skills:  Entry level experience with Data Warehousing highly desirable.  1+ years of experience with Informatica PowerCenter 9.5 or higher  1+ years of experience with ETL development ingesting data from diverse and large data sources  1+ years of experience with relational databases used to support BI analytics. Postgres and Oracle experience highly desired.  Experience working in Agile Knowledge of the Agile, including Scrum and Kanban, and management tools (e.g., Jira, Confluence)  Familiarity with GIT and branching strategies  Should be able to write basic SQL queries  Self-driven with the ability to adapt quickly, work in a challenging and fast paced environment within cross-functional teams, and to promote creative problem solving within their team  Excellent analytical, communication and organizational skills  Must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills with for both technical and non-technical audiences.  Experience working in AWS Cloud environment  Experience with Microsoft Office Suite including Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio  Experience with Databricks/Apache Spark, Kafka, AWS Data Migration Service (DMS) highly desired   Education:  Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline preferred – Computer Science, Mathematics, or equivalent technical degree, or the equivalent combination of education, professional training, and work experience  Location:  Reston, VA - must reside in DMV area / remote flexibility  Clearance:  Must be a US Citizen and be able to obtain a government agency Suitability Clearance. USCIS Entry on Duty (EOD) preferred   About Metric5  Metric5 is a small business with big company benefits. We have a passionate team of smart, fun-caring professionals, and we are here for the long haul. Join our close-knit growing team in a business where your contributions make an enormous impact. Our organization offers a comprehensive employee benefits package, continuous professional development, with a best in class company culture that is enjoyable to work in and supports the growth of each of our professionals.  Our benefits include:  Health & Dental Insurance 100% of individual coverage paid for by the company  Vision Insurance  HSA & FSA Plans Offered  Life & Short Term Disability Insurance  401K with company match (employees are immediately vested)  Paid Vacation  9 Paid Holidays per year (plus 2 paid floating holidays)  Maternity and Paternity Leave  Employee bonuses  Professional Development reimbursement program  Tuition Assistance Program   Metric5 is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability, protected veteran status, race, color, religious creed, national origin, citizenship, marital status, sex, sexual orientation/gender identity, age, or genetic information. Metric5’s commitment to diversity and inclusive selection practices includes ensuring qualified long-term unemployed job seekers receive equal consideration for employment.

job_title: Principal Product Manager Tech, Amazon Athena
job_Description: · BS or BA degree · 10+ years of experience, with at least 7 in product management or equivalent roles · Strong technical acumen. Can dissect complicated technical problems, simplify experiences and innovate on behalf of our customers · Both technically deep and business savvy to interface with and lead teams of all levels and disciplines within an organization, from engineers to senior leadership · Experience collecting, analyzing, and summarizing data from disparate sources in order to drive conclusions and recommendations · Have an entrepreneurial spirit and be able to work independently and effectively in a results-oriented, efficient environment · Strong track record of delivering products and ensuring customer success · Excellent written communication skills      Job summary  Want to work at the cutting edge of big data, analytics, and machine learning? Interesting in helping customers get insights from their data wherever it might be with a serverless SQL query service? Come join us on the Amazon Athena team.    We are hiring a Principal Product Manager - Technical to lead the product roadmap for significant investment areas in Athena, such as federated queries across data sources, machine learning integrations with analytics, and simple-to-use UIs to manage and execute a variety of analytics workloads.     Data is everywhere and customers need to quickly and efficiently query and analyze petabytes of data interactively is growing every year. Amazon Athena makes it possible so customers can get insights from their data in S3, relational databases, and other data stores in seconds. We work at the core of what makes a query engine tick, developing new capabilities from the ground up and doing it in the most performant and cost-effective way while being exceptionally easy to use. We are a small, entrepreneurial team that operates independently, but with access to some of the top engineers in our field across AWS.    We are looking for a candidate that is obsessed with delivering the most customer-centric experience on the planet, showing proven success in ownership, bias for action, and thinking big. This seasoned leader will need to exhibit excellent judgment, prioritizing between existing versus new customers and between features, architectural improvements, and operational excellence. Candidates should also be experienced business owners who are comfortable advocating for their vision with the most senior AWS leaders, but also working closely with customers and engineering teams to dive deep into details to make ideas into reality. We need a passionate product management leader who dives deep and has shown demonstrated success in building strong business cases, managing high-growth, successful large-scale product launches, and driving customer success.    About Us    Inclusive Team Culture  Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.    Work/Life Balance  Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.    Mentorship & Career Growth  Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.              Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science (related field) or equivalent work experience     MBA or equivalent masters degree     3+ years of product management experience in the cloud computing technology space     Experience with open-source big data and analytics technologies such as Presto, Apache Spark, and Apache Hudi     Experience creating and productizing analytics and visualization tools and services     Proficient in SQL     Strong finance related skills relating to P&L management and pricing        Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Career Opportunity: The Packaging Development Scientist/Engineer provides technical contributions to WestRock’s Material Technology in the development of converting barrier coated paperboard materials into various shapes such as cups, trays, containers, tubes, pouches and other formats for food service and other commercial applications. The ideal candidate will have strong materials background and hands-on industrial experience with paper converting equipment, tooling and processes including thermoforming and molding or shaping techniques.  How You Will Impact WestRock: Apply engineering science and technology in forming of various shaped articles from bench to manufacturing scale. Design, install and operate new paper machines to create new products. Design and lead production of innovative packaging prototypes utilizing lab and pilot plant thermoforming or molding or tooling systems. Plan and perform package printing and converting trials for folding carton, corrugated packaging, tray, cup, tube, and other formats in the commissioning and qualification phases. Independently, lead package filling and packing trials and evaluations in the collection of performance and operational data at customer plants. Interface with (internal/external) Project Managers/Leaders in the development and transformation of package forms and systems to run new packages at customers’ facilities. Actively engage with customers to deliver necessary results. Set up and conduct trials on WestRock’s pilot packaging equipment, independently without direct supervision. Manage and perform wide range of testing and analysis on prototype packages. This includes barrier performance, package strength and stability characteristics, package and product compatibility, supply and distribution performance, and shelf-life performance. Coordinate and work with outside vendors and suppliers in the evaluation and recommendation of external materials and components for new packages. Ability to work on a cross-functional team charged with developing and recommending solutions to packaging problems or needs. Use design of experiment and statistical methods to evaluate and predict the performance of packaging. Apply the statistical and quality methodologies including SPC, SQC, FEMA, Root Cause Analysis, Repeatability & Reliability, and Design of Experiments. Knowledge of computer aided 3D tooling designs and engineering drawings. Knowledge of food contact and regulatory compliance.  What You Need to Succeed: PhD in Mechanical Engineering, Material Science, Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Protective/Food Packaging Technology or equivalent. Minimum 5 years paper products converting experience in R&D for converting or paper packaging company for consumer and food service market applications. Technical knowledge of packaging converting processes for one or more of the following: blow molding, thermoforming, cup/tray forming, carton manufacturing, filling, and sealing systems, and flexible films. Understanding of the packaging supply chain and the fit for use criteria for primary, secondary, and tertiary packaging. Strong project management skills - Ability to prioritize and execute projects against tight deadlines. Strong communication and presentation skills. Team Player with strong collaboration skills. Lead and coordinate projects with other engineers, technicians, and cross-functional team members. Develop and document standard operating procedures for paper and tooling equipment processes.  What We Offer: Corporate culture based on integrity, respect, accountability and excellence Comprehensive training with numerous learning and development opportunities An attractive salary reflecting skills, competencies and potential A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of the daily work.  About WestRock (NYSE:  WRK) partners with our customers to provide differentiated paper and packaging solutions that help them win in the marketplace. WestRock’s 50,000 team members support customers around the world from more than 320 operating and business locations spanning North America, South America, Europe, Asia and Australia. Learn more at www.westrock.com. WestRock is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer committed to creating and maintaining a diverse workforce: Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans #LI-KM1

WireWheel is revolutionizing the area of privacy and data protection by helping companies to build and manage cutting-edge and scalable privacy programs. Recognized by IDC Marketplace, Forrester, and Gartner as a leader in worldwide data privacy management software, our cloud-based Data Privacy & Protection Platform is built by privacy experts using industry best practices to help organizations simplify, structure, and automate their approach to privacy program management. We help companies comply with today's California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) and EU General Data Privacy Regulation (GDPR) requirements and remain ready for any future regulatory regimes.  We are currently looking for a  Director of Product Management  to join our team, and help shape and execute on the product vision and strategy of our Privacy SaaS platform. This is a multi-disciplinary role that focuses on the Product team's mission of delivering a valuable product that customers love. Candidates will need to feel equally comfortable working directly with clients, performing market research, working with developers on feature definition, or jumping in to help with customer support issues.  A successful candidate will have the ability to shepherd an idea into a powerful new capability by balancing market factors, client feedback, technical scope, and user experience.  This means you will:   Own the vision and roadmap for the product. Determine key product initiatives and development milestones. Make critical allocation decisions.  Lead a team of product managers to success. Make hiring decisions, manage performance, provide ongoing coaching.  Define and measure successful business outcomes. Benchmark against the competition. Assume accountability for results while delegating decision-making authority to individual PMs.  Understand user and customer pain points, translate them to broad product solutions, phase solutions to deliver incremental business value. Elegantly deal with resource and time limitations.  Act as a mentor across the product management team and the company. Proactively identify root issues and address them with little or no oversight.  Represent your product to high-profile executives inside and outside WireWheel. Participate in strategic client and partner presentations.   What we are looking for:   Demonstrated ability to define a product vision and strategy to realize it  6+ years experience working with enterprise-level customers in both customer support and success roles as well as a market researcher or working with SaaS deployments in enterprise environments  5+ years prior experience working with the full SaaS Product Management lifecycle (from idea to launch to scaling and later sunsetting a product) tools and techniques  3+ years experience managing people, ideally product managers, designers and/or engineers  Comfortable authoring and maintaining documentation  Experience and acumen working with quantitative models, especially related to forecasting  Comfortable working as well with senior members of the team as well as demonstrated experience working at fine-grain detail with high-caliber engineering and design teammates  Familiarity with competitive analysis and benchmarking techniques  Willing to roll your sleeves up to keep releases on schedule  Strong release management experience using a 'working in an Agile product development' process  Strong product UX design abilities  Ability to understand the product implications of technical architecture and implementation decisions   Bonus Points For:   Domain expertise in big data analytics and cloud architectures, API or data integration, or data science/machine learning enterprise SaaS and/or data security product line experience  Experience in both startup and enterprise product management  Prior experience in sales engineering, technical consulting, solution architecture or software engineering  Familiarity with value engineering or other quantitative prioritization models   People are what make WireWheel awesome! Regardless of age, education, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, or any personal characteristics, we want everyone to feel welcome. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive equal opportunity workplace everyone can call home.

Automation Anywhere is the world’s #1 cloud automation platform, delivering intelligent RPA solutions across all industries globally to automate end-to-end business processes, for the fastest path to enterprise transformation. The company offers the world’s only cloud-native platform combining RPA, artificial intelligence, machine learning, and analytics to automate repetitive tasks and build enterprise agility, freeing up humans to pivot to the next big idea, build deeper customer relationships and drive business growth. For additional information, visit www.automationanywhere.com.     Our opportunity:     Automation Anywhere is searching for an experienced Field Marketing Manager to join our North American regional and partner marketing team. We are looking for a strategic regional marketing rockstar with a proven track record of establishing strong relationships with sales leaders and building pipeline acceleration programs to engage customers and prospects with targeted campaigns and high touch field marketing activities.     Do you thrive on being able to track and measure the impact your programs have on the bottom line? If you are a jack of all trades – strategic thinker, problem solver, data nerd – then come join our team!     Location:  Remote role - ability to work within any U.S time zone     You will make an impact by being responsible for:         Serving as a trusted advisor to regional sales leaders      Driving regional brand awareness, messaging and marketing programs      Building and executing the regional marketing strategy to ensure alignment with partner marketing, and sales priorities, pipeline and revenue goals      Reporting and measuring your regional programs impact on pipeline      Collaborating with marketing stakeholders to highlight calls to action for personas and account segments, as well as creating relevant marketing messages, use cases, assets, and channels      Collaborating with the global campaigns team to build campaigns that can be leveraged regionally      Enabling SDRs with messaging and content for targeted follow-up      Providing flawless execution of field marketing plans in order to deliver a world-class end-user experience      Having ability to travel up to 25% when safely able to do so        You will be a great fit if you have:         Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, or a technical field      5+ years of experience in field marketing or demand generation roles with proven results, SaaS experienced preferred      Proficiency in Salesforce and Tableau      Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment and to juggle and prioritize across many simultaneous projects        You excel in these key competencies:         Organized and programmatic thinker; ability to develop campaign recommendations and plans with a mix of creative and analytical thinking      Ability to analyze data and present results to a group in a clear, digestible manner      Proven track record of generating pipeline in net new logos and expanding customer accounts      Previous experience of working within a cloud and or business software industry is desirable      Able to clearly communicate new ideas, programs, processes and outcomes to both internal and external stakeholders      Team player with the flexibility to adjust to the dynamic nature of a high-growth organization        Why Automation Anywhere?     At our company each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference.  As the leader in Robotic Process Automation (RPA), we provide a very compelling product where our teams are breaking new ground every day and given an environment to grow their skills and have fun along the way. Our technology is the game changer, and our people give us the edge to better our world and go be great!    #LI-LD1  #LI-REMOTE

KBR is looking for a Principal AI/Autonomous Systems Engineer to support a government customer in Alexandria, VA. The selected candidate will provide direct engineering support to the Office of the Undersecretary of Defense Research and Engineering Prototyping and Experimentation Mission Directorate.        Responsibilities   Include:         Support the planning, coordinating, and execution of a large-scale multi-year demonstration and experimentation campaign to evaluate the operational utility of prototypes in a multi-domain environment.      Support the development of a strategy and framework for identifying prototype mission capabilities into demonstration or experimentation venues to evaluate their operational utility.      Produce concepts of operations, lessons learned, or technical reports to identify operational successes and capability gaps to maximize the campaign’s alignment to mitigate gaps.      Build interest and engagement from Military Service to establish Tactics Techniques and Procedures (TTPs) to facilitate the transition of prototyping capabilities into programs of record for sustainment.           Qualifications:         Master’s Degree in engineering, scientific, or technical discipline that is relevant to AI/Autonomous Systems or C3ISR      Minimum of 15 years of AI/Autonomous Systems and C3ISR experience. Experience must include system engineering experience in these areas:            Chief System Engineer (CSE) or Deputy CSE for a $100M+ technology design, manufacturing, integration, and/or test program        working knowledge of the Systems Development Lifecycle, the “V-Model”; understanding of the Agile Development process        establishing a Risk Management process on a technology development program        experience in a leadership role on classified programs at the SCI level or above           Knowledge of the DoD Defense Acquisition System      Military or OSD experience           Security Clearance Requirements : Active TS required; must have SCI eligibility

job_title: AI Security and Perception Artificial Intelligence Engineer
job_Description: Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us.        MITRE’s newly established AI Security and Perception Department within the Artificial Intelligence and Autonomy Innovation Center consists of a multi-generational, diverse team united by a passion and a sense of urgency to harness AI to help solve problems in the public interest. We discover, create, lead through empowering an inclusive community of collaborative innovators, learners, and technical creatives. We’re looking for people with a lifelong commitment to learning, who are passionate about harnessing artificial intelligence to make a positive impact in the world. We’ve built a supportive and inclusive environment where collaboration is encouraged, and learning is shared freely. We value our diversity of experience, knowledge, backgrounds, and perspectives and harness these qualities to discover connections, solve problems, and create extraordinary impact.        As a Senior Artificial Intelligence Engineer, you will:         Be part of a team developing and implementing AI algorithms to help address critical national and global challenges like global health, climate change and national security      Develop and use modern software engineering techniques to develop AI-related software      Maintain knowledge of advances of AI capabilities in industry and academia      Evaluate AI solutions and compare to sponsor requirements and needs      Contribute to the technical work program of one or more projects and produce quality products focused on successful sponsor outcomes      Provide thought leadership and collaborate with academic and industry partners      Provide exemplary leadership, caring mentorship, and collaborative technical advice to staff           Minimum Qualifications:         Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Cybersecurity, or related technical field      Must be a U.S. citizen with ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance      3+ years’ work experience in machine learning, deep learning, computer vision, statistics, and/or related fields      Hands-on experience using tools such as: C/C++, Python, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, dlib, and database languages      Outstanding written and oral presentation skills are required for both internal and sponsor-facing communications        Preferred Qualifications:         Advanced degree in related field of study      Candidates that possess a current/active US Government clearance are preferred      Proven experience with Statistical Methods, Neural Networks, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, Data Science, Privacy, Trust & Safety, Software Engineering or similar           This requisition requires the candidate to have a minimum of the following clearance(s):        This requisition requires the hired candidate to have or obtain, within one year from the date of hire, the following clearance(s):        Subject to all federal and state laws, rules and regulations, MITRE requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Newly hired employees must be fully vaccinated prior to their employment start date. MITRE will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals who are legally entitled to an exemption under applicable laws so long as it does not create an undue hardship for MITRE and/or does not pose a direct threat to the health or safety of the employee or others in the workplace.        MITRE is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. MITRE recruits, employs, trains, compensates, and promotes regardless of age; ancestry; color; family medical or genetic information; gender identity and expression; marital, military, or veteran status; national and ethnic origin; physical or mental disability; political affiliation; pregnancy; race; religion; sex; sexual orientation; and any other protected characteristics.
